title: Queen's Speech: Dutch-style pensions, lost pots and crackdown on rogue company bosses
text:
Savers who have lost track of pension pots from years ago could soon find it easier to track them down after the Government announced it will compel providers to share data.

Experts have warned, however, that the long-awaited pensions dashboard – dubbed the “open banking” of pensions – is still likely to be years away.

Open banking forced banks to make customer data available to other providers, with the individual’s consent, meaning a person could view all their accounts in a single place. The idea for a pensions dashboard is similar, theoretically making it easier to find a lost pension.
